intro: Phyllorkis limbata, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, silvery-green leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and adaptability to various soil types. Phyllorkis limbata is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
